guiPack

Class LineModeller

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiPack.LineModeller

  • public class LineModeller
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is an engine component to our program that does all the math to determine where to draw on the map given the path provided by the EngineController.
    Author:
    Douglas Wallin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.awt.image.BufferedImage canvas
      This BufferedImage is representative of the state of the map image in the program.
      private java.lang.String original
      This is where the original map is stored in the file system.

    • Field Detail

      • canvas

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage canvas
        This BufferedImage is representative of the state of the map image in the program.

      • original

        private final java.lang.String original
        This is where the original map is stored in the file system. This String is used to revert back to it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • LineModeller

        public LineModeller(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Constructor for the LineModeller. Sets the canvas equal to the image passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        image - BufferedImage: The image being passed to the LineModeller

    • Method Detail

      • drawDiagonal

        public void drawDiagonal(MapNode node1,
                         MapNode node2)
        This method uses all the helper functions to assemble a list of xy coordinates on the map between two nodes. It then accordingly alters the RGB of pixels on the map to give the effect of "drawing" on the map.
        Parameters:
        node1 - MapNode: The first of the two nodes
        node2 - MapNode: The second of the two nodes

      • getYPoints

        private java.util.List<Tuple<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>> getYPoints(int x1,
                                                                              int x2,
                                                                              int y1,
                                                                              int y2)
        The method returns a list of points between two points using some other helper methods.
        Parameters:
        x1 - int: The x value of the first point
        x2 - int: The x value of the second point
        y1 - int: The y value of the first point
        y2 - int: The y value of the second point
        Returns:
        List> A list of points

      • getXValue

        private int getXValue(int y,
                      double slope,
                      int xRef,
                      int yRef)
        This method finds the f(y) of the y parameter passed in using the point slope formula.
        Parameters:
        y - int: The y value for which we want to find the f(y)
        slope - double: The slope variable for the equation
        xRef - int: The x value for the point to be referenced in the equation.
        yRef - int: The y value for the point to be referenced in the equation.
        Returns:
        int The f(y) value

      • getYValue

        private int getYValue(int x,
                      double slope,
                      int xRef,
                      int yRef)
        This method finds the f(x) of the x parameter passed in using the point slope formula.
        Parameters:
        x - int: The x value for which we want to find the f(x)
        slope - double: The slope variable for the equation
        xRef - int: The x value for the point to be referenced in the equation.
        yRef - int: The y value for the point to be referenced in the equation.
        Returns:
        int The f(x) value
